country.name: Iran
country.overview: Iran is an Islamic republic on the Persian (Arabian) Gulf with historical sites dating to the Persian Empire. Extensive marble ruins mark Persepolis, the empire’s capital founded by Darius I in the 6th century B.C. The modern capital, Tehran, is home to opulent Golestan Palace, seat of the Qajar Dynasty (1794–1925), plus modern landmarks such as the 435m-high Milad Tower.

translations.name: ປະເທດອີຣານ
အီရန်နိုင်ငံ
ประเทศอิหร่าน

geography.location_description: Middle East, bordering the Gulf of Oman, the Persian Gulf, and the Caspian Sea, between Iraq and Pakistan
geography.area_note: almost 2.5 times the size of Texas; slightly smaller than Alaska
geography.climate: mostly arid or semiarid, subtropical along Caspian coast
geography.terrain: rugged, mountainous rim; high, central basin with deserts, mountains; small, discontinuous plains along both coasts
geography.hazards: periodic droughts, floods; dust storms, sandstorms; earthquakes
geography.notes: strategic location on the Persian Gulf and Strait of Hormuz, which are vital maritime pathways for crude oil transport
